duties_responsibilities.duty: Support collaborative R&D projects by assisting in the execution of experiments and documenting test plans and results.
Be proficient in using the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) for data analysis and reporting.
Utilize materials testing equipment for tasks such as scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and energy dispersive spectrometer (EDS) to analyze materials.
Work effectively in a team setting, with strong communication skills to contribute to a wide range of projects.
Demonstrate creativity and critical thinking to propose new ideas and actively contribute to ongoing project work.
Adhere to laboratory safety protocols and maintain accurate records in a laboratory notebook.
Flexible work schedule of 20 to 25 hours per week, accommodating school schedules.

education_certification.credential: Junior or senior year classwork in an appropriate science or engineering field with a high GPA. (US Citizenship or green card required)
